S. Korean warmongers stage anti-air ball-firing exercises 
     Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- The South Korean warmongers staged anti-air ball-firing exercises in a shooting range on the west coast of South Korea on Nov. 22, according to a news report from Seoul.
   They conducted firing exercises of various forms, crying out for increased anti-air combat capacity  to repel a "surprise air attack of enemy planes in an emergency."    
   They announced that there would be target practices for portable surface-to-air guided missile "mistral"  and the bulkan artillery pieces deployed around Seoul in 1992.
